definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
abbr. for 柬埔寨[Jian3 pu3 zhai4], Cambodia

sentences.english: A: Jane, I just got your invitation.
sentences.chinese: 簡，我剛收到你們的請柬。

sentences.english: Becky sent out the invitations and started preparations confidently.
sentences.chinese: 蓓基寄出請柬之後開始放心大膽地着於做準備了。

sentences.english: Some people will write "monetary gifts preferred" on their wedding invitations.
sentences.chinese: 一些人會在婚禮請柬上註明“樂於接受現金”。

sentences.english: She issued all these invitations without any reference to her superiors.
sentences.chinese: 她未請示上級擅自把所有這些請柬都發了出去。

sentences.english: The invitation specified that the dress code would be formal, so I donned my tuxedo.
sentences.chinese: 請柬規定要着正裝，於是我穿上了燕尾服。

sentences.english: I don't know whether our invitation card has already reached him.
sentences.chinese: 不知道我們的請柬是否已經到達他那裏。

sentences.english: We don't know if our invitation has arrived him.
sentences.chinese: 不知道我們的請柬是否已經到達他那裏。

sentences.english: I wrote close to fifty invitations this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨我寫了近五十封請柬。

sentences.english: Many close friends of the Fok family said they had received invitations to the upcoming grand wedding ceremony in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 近日，不少與霍家相熟的好友都已相繼收到請柬。

sentences.english: Jane, I just got your invitation.
sentences.chinese: 簡，我剛收到你們的請柬。

sentences.english: For oversea exhibitors, we will send the Invitation Card by airmail.
sentences.chinese: 主辦單位將會以空郵寄出請柬予海外參展商。

sentences.english: Offer large quantities of visit tickets and invitation cards for exhibitors to invite customers.
sentences.chinese: 提供大量參觀券和請柬供參展商邀請客戶。

sentences.english: She was so good at calligraphy she hand-lettered her own wedding invitations.
sentences.chinese: 她寫得一手好書法，她的婚禮請柬都是自己寫的。

sentences.english: I just broke up with Jane.
sentences.chinese: 簡，我剛收到你們的請柬。

sentences.english: The invitation to the gala performance is marked 'black tie.
sentences.chinese: 觀看特別演出的請柬上注有“請戴黑領結”字樣。

definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
